title: Has a Mythbusters experiment ever had an impact on real world science? - Quora

response.answer_text: I can’t see that as being very likely, at least directly. I watched all of the Mythbusters series, but I can’t recall any of them that didn’t fall into the category of one of: Seeing if this thing that happened in a movie/story/historical record/urban legend can be really doneProof of an existing thing that science knew about“What happens if we…?”The Mythbusters methodology was very light and un-rigorous (at least what was shown in the episode) and typically their sample sizes were tiny. Which is OK - it is basically a light entertainment programme. However… it is very likely that a whole generation of future scientists have been inspired by the ethos of “finding stuff out”, because at its heart, that’s what science is. So in that arena, they have definitely had an impact.

Scientific questions of consequence nowadays require lots of highly trained scientists with expensive equipment and years of work to resolve. The Mythbusters didn’t have any of those elements, so answering any deep science questions was not going to happen. But to their credit, they did use solid approaches to the problems they tackled. They designed experiments to prove or disprove the myth in question using good scientific methodology. Not bad for some folks who weren’t trained scientists.
